definitions.text: a covering designed to be worn on a person's body
the act of having on your person as a covering or adornment
examples: she bought it for everyday wear
She was wearing yellow that day

definitions.text: have in one's aspect; wear an expression of one's attitude or personality

examples: The constant friction wore out the cloth

definitions.text: have or show an appearance of
examples: wear one's hair in a certain way
This dress wore well for almost ten years
The old chair finally fell apart completely

definitions.text: exhaust or get tired through overuse or great strain or stress
examples: We wore ourselves out on this hike
He put on his best suit for the wedding
The princess donned a long blue dress
The queen assumed the stately robes
